p: Quantitative analyses of lemongrass essential oil were performed in triplicate using a gas chromatograph (GC-17A, Shimadzu, Kyoto, Japan) equipped with flame ionization detector (FID). Chromatographic conditions were: a fused silica capillary column (30 m × 0.22 mm) with a DB-5 bonded phase (0.25 μm film thickness); carrier gas N 2 at a flow rate of 1.8 mL min −1; injector temperature of 220 °C; detector temperature of 240 °C; column temperature programmed to begin at 40 °C (remaining isothermal for 2 min) and increase at 3 °C min −1 to 240 °C (remaining isothermal at 240 °C for 15 min); 1 μL injection volume (1% w/v in dichloromethane); 1:10 split ratio and 115 kPa column pressure.
